page.title: 11CUSTOMS
page.content: A custom which has been kept up for over a century is known as Bun and Penny. The origination is unknown and the earliest records are to be found in th school log books. In the 1870's the children were taken to Penny Hill on December 21st to be presented with sweets,buns or pennies. The distribution was made by the wealthier ladies of the village. In return the children danced around the tree on the green. During the 1920's Mrs. Bridgeman of Court Farm took over the giving of Buns and Pennies to the school children and this custom has been followed by Mr. and Mrs. P. Gordon the present occupants.Now the children go to Court Farm on the last day of the Christmas Term when they are presented with buns and newly minted pennies.
